title: Perfect example of what I think is wrong with smurfing (from a smurf)
body:
I may smurf, but I play in a fairly close elo to my main and I definitely do not shit talk people while playing. It is uncommon, but occasionally I run into pretty high rated smurfs that act like total asshats. They frequently brag about their skill, trash talk the peoples' they are playing with skill level and are often streaming.

~Plat 2 elo, enemy mid links twitch with a "duo master smurfs, unranked to diamond" title. Respectable viewer count of ~180, guy plays incredibly cocky and gets himself first blooded.

1 hard carry later...

https://i.gyazo.com/9532ecfbc70b884bd68b0572cebdd4b3.png

Duo is bitching about Talon being OP and how "that Talon is just plat garbage and won't climb", then they decide to go play on bronze accounts where they continue being toxic. While it was great fun embarrassing these idiots, I do wish that people who go full asshole mode like this on decent sized streams had some repercussions. 

Even in the top 20 league streams there are plenty of people who do this regularly and see no punishment. They play at massive skill differences (I'm talking master+ in silver/gold) and feel the need to degrade the people they are playing with in front of a 1000+ viewership. When these type of people become part of the top 20 streams for league I feel like it makes toxicity seem acceptable.

replies.body: I can agree with you there. If a smurf really has to play platinum level in BRONZE to feel good about themselves while making lower skill players feel bad then they shouldn't play the game at all. This is unfair to people trying to get better.

Eventually being the key word, your superior knowledge will still screw over countless newbies in the meanwhile who dont really stand a chance just because you are that much better.

And those people will just feel aggravated over the fact they got an opponent that they could not possibly beat unless you yourself started to misplay badly.

how does it screw, when im playing champ that i suck at to practice?
gotta think before u go butthurt

Even if i play main, i will go up sooner or later. Dont be madXD
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}} 


>screw over countless newbies in the meanwhile who dont really stand a chance just because you are that much better.

Isnt this a excuse for bronze and silver cuz they cant climb?
If they are good, they will climb, if they suck, they wont be able to climb.
one game doesnt prevent them from climbingXD


>cry cry im stuck in silver cuz i had 1 game i met smurf. Except that i did all good and played hundreded of games in silver. Im silver cuz of that 1 game of smurf cry cry

Dude.

Your definition of "sucks" is still 10 times better than the average silver/bronze player if you have reached plati.

You seriously cant comprehend the difference between the ranks at all?

Excuse for silvers and bronzies because they cant climb? 

Man do you think anyone learns anything by being crushed so hard that they only see stars? The difference is so wide they cant even tell what you did differently.

And i climb to plati 5 every season before stopping, my normals MMR is sitting comfortable around high plati going by how i keep going up against diamonds the moment i win 2-3 games in a row.

And i have rarely played more than 20~ games in silver that i can recall, ever, my shortest run to plati was just about 80 games gettting choked on gold because i kept getting a bunch of high plats vs my own low gold in promos x)

I have hardly ever suffered from smurfing, rather i could be considered to do it when i climb up every season as i tend to win my first 15 games very quickly with only a few bad breaks in between.

But the difference? I'm not doing it deliberately, rather its how the system works.

There is no excuse for screwing the newbies over hard because you are afraid of wounding your self esteem by playing a botgame and a couple of normals to learn a new champ :/

......Not that you seem to ever have had much of it given the fact that you clearly have no hesitation in doing it <.<

I do understand how it feels for a smurf to be playing in bronze games and essentially destroying them, but the more I play in platinum, the more I tend to just wanna play in silver.

Eventually (around gold 4 elo), you reach this point, where your personal skill, no matter how good you are, won't let you 1v9. For example, in bronze, I can take Jarvan jungle, go full AD and win the game 99% of the time. This can't happen in that rate at above gold 3, except if MAYBE you are a top tier challenger or pro player, who takes advantage macro decisions and insane mechanics, and then it still requires your team to AT LEAST be not trash and follow up on your lead.

Seeing how I was plat 3 this season and I got series of monkey teammates and how I don't still know what my skill ceiling is, I couldn't carry and win some games, eventually dropping back to plat 5. Even if I was doing well, I couldn't really use my advantage against 2-3 enemies who were fed, because there was either no way it could happen, or I wasn't good enough mechanically and in macro play to make it work.

With all that said, I come back to my point about wanting to be in silver. Why? Because in silver, I know that IF I DO WELL, then most chances are that I will be rewarded with a victory, regardless of how good or bad the other 9 players are. I do well, I win. Sometimes, I need to play extra well, in order to overcome some opposition, and there might be a game here and there that I lose, but that's rare. Generally, I play well and I get the satisfaction of victory. In higher up, even if I play well, if my team doesn't play accordingly well, I'm not guaranteed to win and that's really frustrating. Teamwork aside, the fact that the solo factor of the game only works in games where your skill level is much higher than the game's makes it so that you have to smurf to be consistently rewarded for good performances.

I haven't played a solo ranked game on this account for 22 days (I got the inactivity message yesterday). I played some flex games (gold 3 currently, starting at silver 1) and I'm having a blast. I enjoy the game there. I also have a couple smurfs. Got one from bronze 1 to silver 2 with a 85% winrate over 40 games, and another silver 2 account, which I don't really play a lot on, but still having a blast when I do.

I HAVE to resort to playing on smurfs, in order to see my good performances in games being rewarded anymore, and that's the sad part. Sure, if I keep on playing on my main, I might climb higher ( I'm pretty confident I can), but, if doing so, means that I have to TRYHARD over 200 games just to bust out a 52% winrate (essentially winning the same amount as losing), while I only really performed bad in let's say 20% of them, then no thanks. I'd rather know that my good performance - won game ratio is somewhere close to 1:1, rather than what would be with the stats above.

> Eventually (around gold 4 elo), you reach this point, where your personal skill, no matter how good you are, won't let you 1v9. For example, in bronze, I can take Jarvan jungle, go full AD and win the game 99% of the time. This can't happen in that rate at above gold 3, except if MAYBE you are a top tier challenger or pro player, who takes advantage macro decisions and insane mechanics, and then it still requires your team to AT LEAST be not trash and follow up on your lead.

....IÂ´ll be blunt with you, If going 1v9 is your dream then you have truly taken a wrong turn somewhere to end up playing league.

Game is a moba, a multiplayer battle arena.

Meaning several players, and by asking to have the power to "1v9" you are essentially asking for the possibility of becoming so strong that no matter what your own team or the enemy team does you cant lose.......as a reward for yourself playing well.

This is what Xin zhao was on release, and trust me, even the people playing him were disgusted with how ridiculous it was. 

But something that many and probably you yourself somehow neglect to think about is the fact that if becomes possible for you to do this then it becomes possible for the enemy players as well.

How about you going 3,0,0 in lane become utterly nonexistent because enemy toplane went 7,0,0 of your own top and jungle and is now winning fights 1v5? Able to towerdive 1v3 and win?

That botlane being twice as powerful as it currently is? Or that enemy assassin literally appearing in 1 second  doing an attack to delete 3 people instantly?

This is the epitome of snowballing, and i have seen it.

Never again, no matter how amusing it was being the one doing it.......it just felt so damn fking terrible having to endure it, no matter what you did it was just purely hopeless.

Current game is team reliant but it is actually possible to pull back up even if a enemy gets fed as hell, i even did so fairly recently. 


> Seeing how I was plat 3 this season and I got series of monkey teammates and how I don't still know what my skill ceiling is, I couldn't carry and win some games, eventually dropping back to plat 5. Even if I was doing well, I couldn't really use my advantage against 2-3 enemies who were fed, because there was either no way it could happen, or I wasn't good enough mechanically and in macro play to make it work.

There are indeed times when you get a team that just cant manage to work together or outright refuse to and play like monkies......or enemy team gets a too big of a lead and play well together resulting in a stomp but such is reality.

In a game where majority matches are played with teams of random people its not strange for teamwork to fall apart constantly. 


> With all that said, I come back to my point about wanting to be in silver. Why? Because in silver, I know that IF I DO WELL, then most chances are that I will be rewarded with a victory, regardless of how good or bad the other 9 players are. I do well, I win. Sometimes, I need to play extra well, in order to overcome some opposition, and there might be a game here and there that I lose, but that's rare. Generally, I play well and I get the satisfaction of victory. In higher up, even if I play well, if my team doesn't play accordingly well, I'm not guaranteed to win and that's really frustrating. Teamwork aside, the fact that the solo factor of the game only works in games where your skill level is much higher than the game's makes it so that you have to smurf to be consistently rewarded for good performances.

A satisfaction bought at the expense of other people suffering for your sake.

The idea is that league is a teamgame, you need to work with other people to win,  the best way to win is to as quickly as possible snowball your lane and help your other lanes win rather than keep pushing your own.

Back when i started the idea was to win lane then run it down to their base until they either collapsed or managed to stop you, but this shifted when junglers got ways to make comebacks and getting killed became more punishing from bounties.


> I haven't played a solo ranked game on this account for 22 days (I got the inactivity message yesterday). I played some flex games (gold 3 currently, starting at silver 1) and I'm having a blast. I enjoy the game there. I also have a couple smurfs. Got one from bronze 1 to silver 2 with a 85% winrate over 40 games, and another silver 2 account, which I don't really play a lot on, but still having a blast when I do.

Again, whatever you might feel i just cant respect a satisfaction bought at the misery of other people, especially when it was done deliberately.

The only time i get a rush ever is when two teams are nearly equal,constantly prodding,skirmsihing, ambushing and fighting each other with any tricks they can think of,regardless of whenever i win or lose........as long as i get to enjoy the rush of such a game winning or losing is irrelevant. 


> I HAVE to resort to playing on smurfs, in order to see my good performances in games being rewarded anymore, and that's the sad part. Sure, if I keep on playing on my main, I might climb higher ( I'm pretty confident I can), but, if doing so, means that I have to TRYHARD over 200 games just to bust out a 52% winrate (essentially winning the same amount as losing), while I only really performed bad in let's say 20% of them, then no thanks. I'd rather know that my good performance - won game ratio is somewhere close to 1:1, rather than what would be with the stats above.

If winning is your only goal and taking games over all by yourself is the only reward you seek then sure, playing on smurfs is the only option.

But i wonder, how long will the satisfaction of bullying those lesser than you last? A joy gained by beating people who barely even know how to fight back?

The only time youÂ´ll be truly challenged is when playing against another smurf, and whats more your growth as a player will quickly stagnate as well.

The only way to grow is the try and overcome your weaknesses while improving your strong points, something i myself admittedly refused to acknowledge for a long time instead of just learning how to play the champs i like properly,

I didn't say that my dream is to 1v9. What I said is that my good performance actually shows results, rather than mostly RNG teammates. Most games go like this: one guy from one team gets fed, 3 guys from the other team get fed, 3 fed guys overrun the 1 fed guy and it's over. The effort from that one guy is completely going to waste. Many times, that's me. My good efforts are going to waste, and I don't like that. I don't like having teammates that are feeding the enemy so hard that I can't do anything with my good performance. Lower elo, I CAN do something about it. I'm not saying I will 1v9, even though some games do feel like that, but I can at least have some solid input before the outcome of the game, as opposed to the stompfest that I have to endure when it's 3 enemies fed vs just me in my actual elo.

.....You can word it nicely but in the end you are still asking for the ability to invalidate 3 enemy players that somehow got a lead because you feel your effort of getting a lead should be rewarded.

While its understandable that you dislike your teammates getting beaten and feeding thats kinda how things work when you play solo, you cant get a godsent team every game, rather thats something hella rare in itself.


If it was approved a single champ had the ability to battle 3 enemy champs no problem this game would truly have died off ages ago, no one would ever want to play against that. 

And have you considered that one or two of those "fed" ones that you apparently constantly play against might be smurfs as well?

If you feel bad having to play against them with your level how do you imagine those below feel having to deal with?

Assuming the matchmaking system places people appropriately in a timely fashion, I have no problem with smurfs for the same reason Blizzard doesn't in Overwatch. Essentially the reasoning is they're gonna get placed where they belong eventually.

I don't smurf personally, but being mostly comfortable with top/mid/support, I wouldn't take that card off the table if I wanted to make an account where I'm an ADC/jng main instead, since I'm not gonna want to throw my rank away practicing a role I know I'll do more poorly in.

I'm also assuming that's what these ranked season changes that Rito just made a video about are supposed to address. I agree it's super shitty for people to just go around and talk smack on people when they're not even realistically at the same rating, but I don't see a huge problem with it. If somebody's game sense is godly and they main jungle in diamond, but want to practice on assassins and whatnot mid, game sense alone won't take them all the way to diamond. If they made a new account I would imagine the lack of mechanical skill would bring them down to a more appropriate rating.

Your argument about people eventually ending up where they are supposed to be sounds good on paper. 


Until you realize that people, like the guy i was replying to, have multiple accounts.

That way they can just play on and off and thus rise up extremely slowly.

And thus there is a large bunch of people who should be much higher sitting down below and just screwing with other people endlessly, for the sake of their own personal enjoyment. 


People arent smurfing for the privilege of "learning the ropes", they are smurfing because they cant be bothered to play a botgame or two to get a feel for the damage and then play a few normals to show they learned anything.


That or they do it because they feel gratification "shitting" on people so far below them in skill its not even a contest.

Sometimes both.


I have no respect for it at all :/

It's sketchy territory lumping people in together, that's what I think.

That said, the only reason I ever see to make a smurf is to A) prepare for my "main" getting banned, and having a backup (which I don't plan on) or B) practice another role or two without ruining my stats on another account. I'm not denying the existence of people like that either who just like to stomp noobs for enjoyment or whatever though, just the thing is that not everybody is like that. Again, I for one am not like that. And if they do end up going through with it, I don't see any reason to even make a smurf account at that point whatsoever.

Ridiculous sophistry, word it as you will but the result is the same, that action serves only to cause tons of people to endure tons of misery they shouldn't have to. 

All for the sake of preserving ones own dignity by not playing a few botgames and under performing a few normals.

I think you're right that it's sort of dumb to do, at least if this new system is getting implemented. I just don't like the cynical tone of lumping everybody in together and assuming somebody's reasoning is the same as somebody else's. I like to judge on a case-by-case basis usually. On top of that, when you really think about it, preserving stats doesn't mean just protecting your KDA or whatever. I for one wouldn't want to go into a ranked game on a champion I don't know, but also bot games don't do the job right, of teaching what a character is like against various champions using various techniques on the actual rift. If that's the case, then just going into ranked after that I'm gonna get my ass handed to me because I don't really have a feel for how to play the character. Then at that point my team mates in my elo are gonna suffer, not newbies. Either way somebody is suffering. It just makes sense, which is why I think Rito wanted to make this change in the first place.

Essentially somebody, myself included, could want to just practice with real people actually trying while also not wanting to go into ranked and ruin their stats knowingly because they don't know what they're doing on a certain character. That's when playing with not as highly skilled players could help. 

I'm just confused why randomly the newbies matter more and shouldn't be harmed as opposed to the "correct" elo people. I don't really consider either one more important, it just makes sense to want to play with lower level people. Again, some people may want to just stomp kids and that's kind dumb even to me, and I don't understand it, but come on. Not 100% of people that have smurfs are like that.

My guess is they were over-confident. I mean, even Faker screws up ONCE in a while, right? Professional basketball players miss their free-throws, professional bowlers don't ALWAYS land strikes, etc. Unless they're in LCS, these guys are basically very skilled amateurs.

Amateurs practice until they can play the game right, and then keep trying to get better.

Professionals practice until they pretty much can't play the game _wrong_.

I mean they definitely underestimated me (I have been in very high mmr games), but the main point was their reaction to losing. 

"Oh we lost a frustrating game in Plat after talking shit? Let's just go stomp bronze and shit talk them to keep the stream entertaining". 

I don't think that type of mentality should be making money on league of legends content. Maybe these guys are a little small, but I can think of 2 streams immediately that pull thousands of viewers that do the exact same thing.

idk why people in Murica so interested in others people's shit rofl

They did specifically link the twitch at the beginning of the game and did do much of the flaming in chat. Regardless I am addressing the larger group that participates in this type of behavior and not these individuals directly. They are but an example of the behavior I am referencing.

Ah I see what you're saying.

Reading comprehension is poor when I haven't had my coffee for the morning!

Personally as long as they arent being total asshats like you described, i wouldnt mind fighting a plat/diamond smurf here and there. Getting my butt stomped out might teach me a thing or two.


But then again, if youre so salty from playing in master and losing, that you hop into a plat game and still lose, thats telling you something.
If I was a miserable person and my only achievement in life was getting to Diamond V, I'd be an asshole too.

High ELO smurfing just needs to be fully banned.

It's toxic. It artificially inflates MMR, they're all hard stuck in their main ELO's that they resort to beating on lower ELO players for satisfaction. People think calling themselves a High ELO smurf gives them the role they want. They intentionally throw games to keep themselves in low ELO. They'll throw games if someone triggers them ONCE because losing a single game means nothing to them. It allows them to ELO boost.

It's a trend that just needs to be eradicated.
This.

I think that's my cue to resurrect this old thread: https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/AtjGhPe4-etiquette-of-smurfing

Written 2 years ago, bur I'm still happy with it ^^'

Smurfing is never ok. One you ruin the experience for people geniunely trying to learn the game, in two ways one you play a role or champion you've never played before end up sucking a losing the game. Or you end up carrying them making the players on the team no better because you carried them. Another is the fact that some smurfs not all smurfs literally give up because this isnt their main account. They lose their lane or another lane loses then they give up and say of this isnt my main so i dont have to try hard. Which leads to them losing, even before they lose lane, someone will have the I dont have to try that hard cuz this isnt my main mentality. 

See in all truth smurfing does not benefit anyone, nor does it actually benefit the actual smurf. If you want to try a new champion play norms, if you want to test a new build on your main play norms. Stop pretending like this is the only reason why smurfing is bad it is toxic and it ruins games for people actually trying to get better.
I smurfed to learn new champions, new roles, and to practice split-pushing. It helps a lot IMO.

You seem to miss the point you can still do that in normals? Why come to low elo and possibly ruin there games like that because you dont know how to paly the role effectly ruining ther game. What if it happened to your elo it would frustrate you wouldnt it. People are trying to get better but their  is one person has no idea what they are doing or isnt playing well. Also you are not the only one trying to get better, you are not helping the people in that elo get better too. You are the only one benefitting from this.

Damn right I am trying to get better and I can say with certainty after smurfing in gold and silver that MOST of that player base is not. Most are not critically thinking about the game and make repeated mistakes over and over and over again.

Most aren't playing to improve and most are just sitting there and complaining about teammates, which is not how you get better.  Silver is hands down the most toxic division on NA. The players are more concerned about what they type to teammates than improving at all.

Normals have too much variance. Players play off roles too much, give up quickly, and there is a wide array of player skill. I am in high platinum and I get silver and gold players in my normal games. 

If I try to learn a champion or role in normals I don't walk away learning too much because I can simply punish the lowest ranked player over and over again. Or sometimes I play against players that are WAY better than me while learning an off-role.

A platinum player playing an off role in silver or gold will still play better than the average silver or gold player.

**I get smurfs all the time in platinum. It's an opportunity to figure out how to improve and get better. Platinum is littered with high diamond smurfs.  Most high elo Diamond players place in high gold or low platinum on their smurfs. I probably get an obvious smurf every 2 or 3 games. Playing against better players helps you improve a lot. Smurfing against novices or newer players can act as a deterrent to learning the game. But Silver doesn't have a lot of smurfs**

You mentality proves my point, you think that the majority of people are not trying to get better that is a toxic mentality. All I am reading from this is that you are benefiting while ruining the game for others, how is that mentality any different from a troll who has fun trolling while all the others suffer, it isnt. 

You facing against lower ranked players does not improve your play at all, you even stated yourself when you said you play against players way lower then you in normals, how is that any different smurfing with ppl in gold and silver. You also stated how you play against someone way better then you, then go on to state how playing against players way better then you benefits you. You flip flop so much.

No one benefits through smurfing you can justify it all you want about how you improve and lie by saying it benefits others. It doesn't it only helps you, feel better. If you want the overall best improvement in your play then you would play against people of your own skill level and learn to paly better then them, how does facing off against people worse then you help you improve?

No, they aren't trying to get better. Most players complain about their teammates in low elo and they aren't critically thinking about the game. If they were thinking and trying to improve instead of grinding games they wouldn't be in silver. I got to Gold V in my first season and I was terrible at the game. I just tried to get better at my champion and role and worked on it.

Smurfing doesn't ruin too much for lower elo players because most smurfs skip out of the lower tiers fast unless they purposely lose games to tank it or barely play on it. 

I climbed my silver 2 smurf to Plat V in about 80 games. Most smurfs can do it in less. 

Either way, smurfing has helped me improved a lot, especially working on teleports and splitting. 

Doesn't matter too much if I can't convince you, but playing on a smurf helps a lot players learn roles and champions in a lower pressure environment that isn't as low as a normal game or flex q. 

Soloq is a better learning environment because it eliminates most variance. If I tried to learn a new role or champion at my current elo I would simply get stomped in ranked. The skills in normals don't often translate to ranked. Ask high elo player they will say learning champions in normals is not very effective and you are better off having a smurf. 

If I play on a smurf I can incrementally learn the role and the champion. Most likely I get to my true rank via a smurf for that role. 

Do I smurf in my main role or main champion? Not often.

I am not going to sit here and explain the case for all Gold/Silver players, because I dont know them. But in the same sense saying that they dont want to get better because they are in  low elo, literally is proving my point that you go into the game with a toxic mindset. Also season change, in this current season, teamplay has a massive influence saying that having good teams isnt necessary is like saying supports have no impact in the game. 

I dont believe that smurfing can ever help a higher elo player in any aspect. How does playing with lower level players then you help you in anyway? They dont even measure up to you in any aspect? Split pushing, you can split push in plat, in fact learning how to split push in plat would be even better because the map awarness and level of play would actually help you unlike in Gold and below, many people dont even look at their mini maps let alone ward. You can't tell me playing against people of your level does not improve you play as much as playing against people of a lower level. It doesnt make any sense.

I am not toxic ha. I have honor level four and I am pretty pleasant person in-game. So don't go accusing me of character issues when you don't know who i am at all. 

Smurfing helps high elo players all the time learn new champions. Ask any high elo player on subreddits like summoner school or streamers. 

If they are learning a complex champion smurfs is how they learn the game.

Oh my split-pushing improved dramatically from playing on my Silver/Gold smurf. Figuring out when to use TP, when to trade objectives, and where to be on the map helped a lot for my main. 

Simply practicing on the smurf enabled me to make decisions quicker on my main, which lead to an improvement in splitpushing in platinum. All it did was expose me to more split-pushing scenarios and tp scenarios and I took more risks with TP.

Helped a lot.  I went from low to high platinum on my main just from getting better at something I thought I was already good at.

So yes, split-pushing purposefully in gold (even though I could group and still win the game) provided more exposure to scenarios of when to split and when to not. I lost games in gold because I purposefully split-pushed the whole game. That lesson is applicable to platinum.

Same things as farming under tower and pushing power spikes.

So? Honor level 4 means nothing, most people give it to the player who did the best that game it means nothing, if seen people with honors who shit talk losing lanes in gold, it means nothing. Also your attitude toward lower elo players is toxic I dont care about you personally, saying that all Low elo players do not want to get better and due to that they are in that elo is toxic thinking.

I never said it wasnt useful to split push in gold, I said you would gain more from learning to split push in plat then you would in gold. You are playing and spliting in a higher level, more map awareness, better reaction time, more wards being placed. Everything is at a higher level, so how is spliting in gold helping you more when you can learn the same thing in a higher level? If you learn it at a higher level you will learn more and be better then if you learned it in gold.

Well if you do have honor 4 it means you aren't toxic or receiving punishments. Once you get punished you lose honor, simple as that.  And it takes a lot to recoup it.
